benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered: PUT • Valid Request: Multiple success paths verify 204 and state changes (TC01, TC02, TC14, TC15, TC23, TC24, TC26).
Headers • Required and optional: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy validation (TC03) and optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment presence/combinations (TC02, TC24).
Path parameters • UUID validation: Invalid paymentId/paymentTransactionId formats return 400 (TC04, TC05).
Non-existing resources: Proper 404 handling for missing payment/transaction and mismatched IDs (TC06, TC07, TC12, TC27).
Request body validation: Missing body (TC09), malformed JSON (TC10), invalid/inconsistent state data (TC08).
AuthN: 401 Unauthorized when credentials are missing/invalid (TC11).
Concurrency: Simultaneous updates ensure consistency and no corruption (TC17).
Resilience/timeouts: Backend slow/unavailable leads to 503/504 or resilience behavior (TC16, TC22).
Performance: High-load behavior assessed with rapid successive PUTs (TC21).
Security hardening: Inputs resilient to SQL injection and XSS (TC18, TC19).
Extraneous inputs: Unsupported body fields ignored (TC13) and extra query parameters ignored (TC25).
gaps: PUT • Partial update policy: No assertion whether unspecified fields are rejected or left unchanged; TC23 only checks required fields but not partial-update semantics.
Idempotency/duplicate submission: No test that repeating the same PUT yields the same final state and 204 without unintended side effects (useful for retries).
Authorization • 403 Forbidden: No scenario for authenticated but non-admin user (RBAC).

Content negotiation/headers: No validation of Content-Type=application/json requirement or 415 Unsupported Media Type for wrong/missing Content-Type; no 406 handling for incompatible Accept header if applicable.
Audit trail: No verification that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted in audit logs/history and retrievable via API.
Atomicity/transactionality: No test that payment transaction and associated payment state update atomically (all-or-nothing) with rollback on failure.
Server error handling: No scenario simulating internal errors (e.g., database failure) to assert consistent 500 response and error body schema.
Required header edge cases: No test for empty/blank X-Killbill-CreatedBy or overlong header values and expected validation response.
Validation boundaries: While max/min values are tested, there is no explicit negative test for out-of-range numeric values or invalid enums beyond generic inconsistent state (TC08).
Verification via public API: Success scenarios assert DB changes abstractly; no follow-up GET to confirm externally observable state/history is correct.
Rate limiting/throttling: No coverage for 429 Too Many Requests behavior under burst traffic (distinct from general performance).
Response semantics for 204: No assertion that response body is empty and headers are appropriate (e.g., Content-Type absent for 204) despite “Produces: application/json” note.
recommendations: Add a partial-update semantics test: (a) only specified fields update and others remain unchanged if partial updates are allowed; or (b) request is rejected with 400 if full object is required.
Add idempotency test: Repeat the same PUT multiple times and verify final state remains stable and response stays 204.
Add RBAC test: Authenticated non-admin user receives 403 Forbidden.
Validate media types: Test missing/wrong Content-Type returns 415; include an Accept header test (406) if the API enforces it.
Add audit verification: After successful update, retrieve audit/history and verify CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded correctly.
Test atomicity: Force a mid-operation failure (e.g., fail state update) and assert no partial persistence; all changes roll back.
Simulate server-side failures (e.g., DB outage) and assert 500 with consistent error payload.
Expand header validation: Empty/blank CreatedBy and excessively long values should be rejected with clear 4xx errors.
Add explicit invalid-range/enum tests for AdminPayment fields to complement max/min value cases.
Validate via read path: After 204, call appropriate GET endpoints to confirm payment and transaction states/history reflect the update.
Consider rate limiting tests to assert 429 behavior or document that it is not applicable for this admin endpoint.
Assert 204 response semantics: Response body is empty and headers are appropriate, clarifying the “Produces: application/json” discrepancy.
